ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.drosophila.embryo

Class EmbryoStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • ij.process.FloatPolygon
      • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.Compartment
        • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.Structure
          • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.drosophila.wingpouch.WPouchStructure
            • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.drosophila.embryo.EmbryoStructure

  • public class EmbryoStructure
extends WPouchStructure
    This class describes the structure of the Drosophila embryo.

    This class extends WPouchStructure as the structure of the embryo is modeled the same way as we do for the wing pouch. Only constructor and copy/clone operators are redefined.

    Version:
    October 25, 2012
    Author:
    Thomas Schaffter (thomas.schaff...@gmail.com)
    See Also:
    WPouchStructure

      • write

        public void write(java.net.URI uri)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        Save to file the data required to reconstruct the structure. Here the data are 1) a list of nodes required to create the snake structure and 2) the center of gravity of each of the four compartment to obtain the information about the orientation of the structure.
        Overrides:
        write in class WPouchStructure
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • read

        public void read(java.net.URI uri)
          throws java.lang.Exception
        Read from file the data required to reconstruct the structure. See the description of the method write(). After loading the data, this object is initialized based on the data contained in the file.
        Overrides:
        read in class WPouchStructure
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
